column9: This is great for controlling fluid retention but my heart does flip flops all day & night, which is extremely bothersome.

column2: puffy, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Have been taking 100 mgs. for a few years and, although it has reduced my high blood pressure and edema from using prednisone, it has been causing sever gout.  The gout episodes have lasted for up to a month.  Quit taking and now the edema is back, but the gout is slowly going away.  Dr. is going to prescribe 20 mgs. a day, so we'll hopefully see an improvement for both the edema and gout.

column9: Potassium levels dropped out of site, Spend one day in ER.  I think this is something to watch.  It could have happen with other water pill, but I don't know.  My feet fill easy it seems.  I take it now but also get blood work ups often.

column1: Fluid in the Lungs due to Chronic Heart Failure
column2: aventurine6@aol.com, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: i have been taking this drug for 13 years with chronic heart failure. the same manufacturer teva supplied it. they have stopped making the 20 mg. tablet so i have been forced to take torsemide from par, and pliva. they do not work the same. i accumulate water have trouble breathing with these other mfgs. they say there is no difference in the pills, but they are different. i have some teva that i take with the others when things get bad, but now am running out of them. looking for a good substitute. so far have not found one. teva torsemide was the best thing that ever happened to me along with nitro. i was so bad doctors were talking heart transplant. but after i started the above medications. i didn't need one. good thing they wouldn't give me one anyway. hopefully this problem will be resolved. i took 30mg. of teva, but 40mg. of the others. see the difference. not equal.

column2: blue boy, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I had been using furosemide 40mg for a couple of years to control my water retention BUT it caused my blood sodium levels to drop to critical level and put me in the hospital for 11 days, but I'm using torsemide now and it works for me with no other problems.

column2: 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Been on this medication off and on for 2 years due to fluid retention caused from other meds taken. Dosage 20 mg's 1 x daily.I enjoy being busy and torsemide taken with other meds causes a severe loss of potassium and salt. It createes cramps sometimes so severe that I can not sleep nights, worst in the evenings. When taken with large doses of potassium and high salt intake it works well. For those concerned about the number of trips to the bathroom it only proves that it's doing its job. Hope this helps. Watch your potassium and salt levels it will need some adjusting to get it correct for your lifestyle and needs.

column2: Jane, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have taken this drug for approximately 4 years along with Zaroxolyn 10 mg. 30 minutes before the 20 mg. of Torsemide.  Sometimes good, sometimes not.  Fluid always returns, short acting.

column1: Accumulation of Fluid Resulting from Chronic Heart Failure

column9: After about one week I have experienced dizziness, blurred vision,constipation& lightheadedness. some fast heart beat & on day ten short of breath

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: This medication is easy to use and works very well BUT I have to stay home for about four hours after taking it as I am in the restroom every 10-15 minutes.  It is a bother and restrictive that way.  The fluid comes back on the next day though so I have to take it everyday.  It is quick acting and short lived. My other diuretic is slower and last several days, but is not as effective.  Everytime I take torsemide oral I get flu like symptoms though and heart palpations but no leg cramps.
